content.description: Sit-start: left hand on jug at top of chossy layers, right on other jug. Pull up to lip then over to mantle top out. Fun powerful moves on big positive holds This is the easier version of Where the Wild Goose Goes, which doesn't include the chossy layers.
content.location: The lowest and furthest right climb, fairly close to the Ballet parking area. Look for the cave on the right side of the strip.

content.description: Topout same as Wild Goose Lite, but the chossy layers are off. Sit-start with both hands on good jugs on the vertical strip and feet on small edges on right face, Pull up to lip-hold on left (can go either hand but very different beta between them) and then wreslte the rough jugs to the top.
content.location: Far right side of the furthest right strip near the Ballet parking lot. Look for the obvious cave.

content.description: Sit-start on the chossy column and traverse left generally along the lowest horizontal crack. Top out as for Candy Bars by the tree
content.location: Start on the right side of the Thorny Boulder just left of the big ~4-foot high ground block

content.description: Get on at the bottom of the wide ridge however you see fit (can start matched on the rough arete rock next to it and then pull on) and then walk/shuffle/climb to the top. VB but super fun!
content.protection: pad and spotter because it finishes high
content.location: Right side of the big cracky slab wall - unmistakable

content.description: Sit-start on the jug just right of the tree. Pull up then traverse right along horizontal crack and then up and right on diagonal crack. Finishes where the line meets the wide 'stairway' ridge coming in from the right by standing up on that ridge. Will be fully top-outable later when cleaned more.Crux is the first couple of moves on fingery crimps and gradually gets easier. Reminiscent of Hobbit Hole but higher and harder.
content.protection: couple pads and a spotter for the second half
content.location: Look for the 20+-foot high wall with multiple horizontal and vertical cracks. Problem starts just right of hemlock tree on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit-start on one or both of the jugs and then use rough sloper/crimps to climb more or less straight up the right face of the rock and top out on the shelf. Directly left of this problem is the much steeper overhang and right of it is the very positive slab  - stay in between them
content.location: This is on the first big boulder below the cell phone tower. Look for the steep rounded overhang, and this problem is just right of it.

content.description: Sit-start with hands on jugs on either side of the white triangle. There are footholds to the sides and a useful toehook all the way in the very back of the cave for getting up and around the lip. Use the vertical bars on the right and left to pull all the way out of the cave and top out left by the tree.
content.location: Left side of the Thorny Boulder (lowest level, nearest the highway), starting in the little cave.

content.description: New bouldering area close to Portland with lots of development opportunity. Only 2 hours of cleaning/climbing by 1 person as of late March 2021, so most of it is green, Stay tuned for routes in upcoming weeks, or go snag and post some FA's of your own!
